page.title: 18GUITING POWER.GROCER,BAKER
page.content: The baker's shop opened in 1961, so is 24 years old.The owners sell bread, cakes and groceries. The flour comes from a Tewkesbury mill, and the groceries from Cheltenham. They have eight machines,bun divider,dough mixer,tart maker,cake mixer,pastry roller,ham slicer,bacon slicer and scales.The fuels used are diesel, oil and electricity. The bakery was once a police- station and the oven was the prison cell. The oven can hold 230 loaves. The baker starts at 3a.m. on Saturday,5.30a.m. other days. There are 200 customers in the 11 villages visited by the van.The van round takes 5 hours to do.They like a village business because they know all their customers. Old people without transport can shop in the village.
